2141.subject: SW
2141.descrlong: This graduate foundation course prepares students for direct practice with individuals, families, and small groups through strength-based assessments and evidence-informed interventions using a cross-cultural perspective. Interviewing skills, assessment tools, case planning, and case management will be covered. Students will gain knowledge of group process including group formation, facilitation, and evaluation. May be offered as classroom based, hybrid, or online course.
